fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if the Windows Service fails to stop when upgrading Jira, the user will not be able to proceed with the upgrade and will receive an unclear message as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/upgrade-fails-to-remove-previous-installation-directory-in-jira-server-313463494.html].

h3. Suggested Solution

The installer should detect that the Jira Service is up and warn the user to avoid the need to investigate the root cause from the error.
fields.summary: Warn users if the Windows Service couldn't be stopped during an upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating linked issues from the Issue Detail view of requests in 'Boards', user is not redirected to the 'Create Linked Issue' page, however, the page refreshes and user is redirected to 'Active Sprints' page.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board from an existing Business or Service Desk project (the bug does not affect Software projects).
 # Head to 'Backlog' and click on an issue to view it.
 # Click on (..) and choose 'Create linked issue'.

h3. Expected Results

User will be redirected to 'Create Linked Issue' page.
h3. Actual Results

User is redirected to 'Active Sprints' page.

 
h3. Workaround

Create linked issue via Issue View.
fields.summary: When creating linked issues from the Issue Detail view of requests in 'Boards', user is redirected to 'Active Sprints' page.

fields.description: Currently the Jira analytics collection can be disabled from Administration - > System - > Advanced - > Analytics and this will stop logging in the $JIRA_HOME/analytics-logs directory. But this does not remove the javascript that fires the POST rest call  /jira/rest/analytics/1.0/publish/bulk. This unnecessarily floods the access logs. The rest endpoint should also be blocked.
fields.summary: Disabling Jira Analytics should stop sending POST requests to /jira/rest/analytics/1.0/publish/bulk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Dragging the last subtask assigned to the current user prompts the user to update the parent task to *Done* status because all of its subtasks are now *Done* where in fact there are still other subtasks hidden by the Kanban sub-filter. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with four subtasks 
# Assign two of the subtasks to the current user while the other two to another user.
!2.png|thumbnail!
# Create a Kanban board which includes the parent issue of this issue, SKP-1  in this example. 
# Go to Board > Configure and set the following:
#* Swimlanes to Stories
#* Kanban sub-filter query to "assignee = currentUser()"
# Back to the board, we will see only two subtask from the parent SKP-1, as expected. 
# Drag these two subtasks to *Done* column (one at a time)
# Notice that when you drag the last subtask, there will be a prompt 
!1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
There shouldn't be a prompt saying that *all* the subtasks are done because there are two more issues (hidden by the filter) that are not done. 


h3. Actual Results
Message prompt appears:
{code}
All sub-tasks for parent issue SKP-1 are now Done.
Do you want to update this parent issue to match?
{code}

h3. Notes
Reproducible in Jira 7.10.2

h3. Workaround
Check the parent issue's issue detail page to double confirm if all the subtasks are indeed done.
fields.summary: Subtasks hidden by the filter is ignored in Kanban board

fields.description: The audit log in Jira does not capture when an application link is created or modified in the application. It would be useful to have this logged in case somebody makes a URL change on accident and for admin peace of mind in general.
fields.summary: Audit log for application links being created/updated

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Currently, mail connection configuration for SMTP/Incoming mail server can only be achieved via the port connection.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Allow mail connection configuration to use API such as Microsoft APIs O365 instead of using the ports.

h3. *Why this is important*
Due to strict security compliance connection via the port is not possible for certain organization as it potentially provides security hole which can be used by attackers.

*Note*: Microsoft is planning to retire SMTP access for Exchange:
https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/blogs/blogarticleprintpage/blog-id/Exchange/article-id/27095
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to communicate Via Microsoft APIs O365

fields.description:
Jira gadgets can be used in Confluence by getting their XML link ([Registering External Gadgets|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/registering-external-gadgets-204050482.html]).

As of Jira 8.4, the Bubble chart gadget does not have an XML link, which means that it cannot be added to Confluence.

The suggestion is to either add the XML link to the gadget, to allow using it on Confluence or to add the chart itself to the list of Jira charts in Confluence:
fields.summary: Bubble chart does not have Show XML link

fields.description:
I've tried sending emails with Jira Workflow Toolbox and cPrime's SIL scripting language that contain URLs with parameters being passed as "&param1=value1&param2=value2"  - in both cases the email arrived with the ampersand encoded (with "amp;" appended).  The plugins say they're not doing it... so it seems some HTML validation in the mail subsystem is a bit overeager.

Some browsers handle the encoding in the URL well, but as far as I can tell most email clients do not.
fields.summary: ampersand in URL within HTML email becomes encoded

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever an issue key is changed for an issue as a result of changing projects and then trying to use the admin importer to make a change using the older issue key, the data gets corrupted.
h3. Environment

Jira Server 7.13.8
 Jira DC
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Create a new issue in Jira in project > Issue gets created with issue key of *ABC-123.*
 2) Now 'Move' that issue to a new project > The issue key now becomes *DEF-234.*
 3) Now export this new issue to a CSV. Ensure before export that the issue navigator, the project and created columns are included in the search results.
 4) Open the exported CSV file and change the create date on it in the column which lists the 'created date' and change the format on the column to dd/MMM/yy h:mm
 5) Change the issue key and project name from *“DEF-234”* to *“ABC-123”* and the corresponding project details as well (such as project key and project name)
 6) Ensure your csv file only has the following columns: Issue Key, Summary, Project Type, Project name, Project Key, Created
 7) Now save the CSV file as Comma delimited CSV UTF-8
 8) Using the Admin importer, perform an import using CSV option.
 9) For Project select 'Defined in CSV' , for date format select dd/MMM/yy h:mm
 10) Map the columns appropriately ("Project name”, "Project key”, “Issue key”, ”Project type”, ”Summary" and "Created" ) in Jira and DO NOT select 'Map Field Value'
 11) Begin Import
 12) After import finishes - Search for *DEF-234*
 - You will notice that this issue is no longer found, but if you search for *ABC-123* from Step 1, it has now become *ABC-234.*

h3. Expected Results

Admin CSV importer to carry out data as intended during the CSV edition, Issue key ACB-123
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Admin CSV Importer changing the issue key causing data corruption

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira nodes created after the cluster has been deployed using the Atlassian-provided AWS CloudFormation templates will fail to install and run Jira if the database collation has been changed to a supported one.

h3. Environment
* AWS CloudFormation deployment using the Atlassian-provided templates.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy a Jira Data Center cluster in AWS following the instructions in https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/jira/. The database will be created using the unsupported collation *{{en_US.utf-8}}*, as reported in JRASERVER-70077.
# Change the database collation to *{{C}}* and table collation to *{{DEFAULT}}* by following the steps in the KB article [Unsupported collation error thrown in Jira server using PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-the-collation-of-a-postgres-jira-database-776657961.html].
# Update the CloudFormation stack, increasing the parameters *{{ClusterNodeMax}}* and *{{ClusterNodeMin}}*, so a new node will be deployed.

h3. Expected Results
The node is deployed correctly, Jira is installed and is able to run normally.

h3. Actual Results
The EC2 instance will be launched, but Ansible automation will fail to install Jira, reporting the following errors:
{noformat}
TASK [database_init : Create application DB user] ******************************
changed: [localhost] => {"changed": true, "user": "atljira"}

TASK [database_init : Update root privs for new user] **************************
ok: [localhost] => {"changed": false}

TASK [database_init : Create application database] *****************************
An exception occurred during task execution. To see the full traceback, use -vvv. The error was: NotSupportedError: Changing LC_COLLATE is not supported. Current LC_COLLATE: C
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": fals
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Jira Data Center AWS CloudFormation templates won't deploy additional nodes correctly if the database collation has been changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira Data Center AWS template creates a database with the unsupported collation *{{en_US.utf-8}}.* This collation is not supported by Jira, as stated in the KB article [Connecting Jira applications to PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-postgresql-938846851.html].

h3. Environment
* AWS CloudFormation deployment using the Atlassian-provided templates.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy a Jira Data Center cluster in AWS following the instructions in https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/jira/.

h3. Expected Results
The database is created using a supported collation.

h3. Actual Results
The database collation used is *{{en_US.utf-8}}*, which is not supported by Jira. The *Collation* health check shows a warning:
{noformat}
Name: Collation
Is healthy: true
Failure reason: The database collation 'en_US.UTF-8' is unsupported by JIRA. The Table collation 'DEFAULT' is supported by JIRA.  A limited number of circumstances could cause unexpected results.
Severity: UNDEFINED
{noformat}

There's a bug report for the *Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools* plugin showing just a warning instead of reporting a non-healthy status, available at https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ATST-790.

h3. Workaround
Customize the template to include the following parameters:
{code}
- "ATL_JDBC_COLLATION=C"
- "ATL_JDBC_CTYPE=C"
- "ATL_JDBC_ENCODING=UNICODE"
- "ATL_JDBC_TEMPLATE=template0"
{code}

h3. Notes
Nodes added to the cluster will fail to install and run Jira if the database collation is changed to a supported one. This is being tracked at *JRASERVER-70078.*
fields.summary: Jira Data Center AWS CloudFormation templates creates a database with an unsupported collation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A user is a member of two LDAP connector type user directories (i.e. LDAP1 and LDAP2) defined on same Jira instance. A user is discovered from the first of these directories according to the order of directory definition (LDAP1). When we delete this user from LDAP1, Jira discovers the user from the second directory (LDAP2) just fine. The user can be searched for, added to local groups, however, cannot be added to a project role.

 !search_user.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * We can't reproduce this on a vanilla Jira installation
 * Reproduced reliably at client instance. 

h3. Expected Results
 * After being disabled on LDAP1, the user, as discovered from LDAP2 with the same username (which was shadowed before) shall be available for project role assignments.

h3. Actual Results
 * User cannot be assigned to a project role (see attached images)
 !assign_user_to_role.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 * Restarting the server.
fields.summary: User cannot be found for role assignment after a directory change

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Cloning an issue with the attachments will not create the issue with the attachments in one go. Instead, it create the issue then attaches the file. 
This is problematic is the create transition requires a file to be attached. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Make the clone operation create the issue with the attachment. 
h3. Workaround
If a validator is present in the create transition, it has to be removed before cloning issues.
fields.summary: Cloning issues with attachments should attach the files at creation time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion report is for *Jira Server*. Using *Jira Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-77434].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition
The current REST API doesn't allow users to add an attachment while creating the issue. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a JSON field to enter a base64-encoded attachment when hitting the [Create issue|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.13.0/\#api/2/issue-createIssue] endpoint. 
h3. Workaround
# Create an issue and capture the issue key. 
# Call the [Add attachment|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.13.0/#api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\}/attachments-addAttachment] endpoint.

h3. Note(s)
The workaround doesn't help if the workflow has a validator to ensure there's an attachment at the time of issue creation.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to create a an issue with an attachment via the REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing an issue content (Description, field, comment etc) that contains a wiki markup, the notification will not render correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head to an issue.
 # Edit a comment or description.
 # View the notification.

h3. Expected Results

Jira will send a notification that is shown as rich text renderer.
h3. Actual Results

Jira will send notification that shows the notification as a default text renderer.

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When editing an issue content (Description, field, comment etc) that contains a wiki markup, the notification will not render correctly.

fields.description: I need to limit WIP count of tasks in progress
fields.summary: WIP limit per assignee

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Running a docker image with MySQL, the dbconfig will have the schema name tag:
{code}
<schema-name>public</schema-name>
{code}

h3. Environment
Docker Setup
Jira 8.4.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run docker with MySQL. Example:
{code}
docker run -v jiraVolume:/var/atlassian/application-data/jira --name="jira" -d -p 8080:8080 -e "ATL_JDBC_URL=jdbc:mysql://192.168.1.0:3306/jiradb" -e "ATL_JDBC_USER=username" -e "ATL_JDBC_PASSWORD=password" -e "ATL_DB_DRIVER=com.mysql.jdbc.Driver" -e "ATL_DB_TYPE=mysql" atlassian/jira-software:8.4.2
{code}
# Once this is up, check the dbconfig.xml

h3. Expected Results
This should be as per [Connecting Jira applications to MySQL 5.7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-5-7-966063305.html] without a Schema Name.

h3. Actual Results
There is a line in the dbconfig.xml that has a schema name: 
{code}
<schema-name>public</schema-name>
{code}

h3. Workaround

Manually remove this line.
fields.summary: Jira Docker image with MySQL adds a schema name in dbconfig.xml breaking the connection to the database

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There's a bug in how we build Lucene queries from JQL when using the DefaultTemporaryIndexProvider. As part of the JQL->LQL translation process, we sometimes run further sub-queries (for cases like issue status change to/from). These always end up targeting the Jira-wide change-history index rather than the short-lived one created by TemporaryIndexProvider. The end result is that the translated JQL query doesn't work as expected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

As part of an action in response to an issue change event, say a transition to "In Progress":
 # call `TemporaryIndexProvider.indexIssuesAndSearch(..)` with a jql query that references the change history index. Something like:

{code:java}
 id = <changed_issue_id> and status = "In Progress" and status changed to   "In Progress"   {code}
h3. Expected Results

The action returns the id of a newly-created issue when it is transitioned to "In Progress"
h3. Actual Results

The action fails to find the issue in its search results.
h3. Notes

This bug initially manifested itself in JSD SLAs not being triggered.
h3. Workaround

Re-running the search once the main Jira change history index has been updated may work in some situations. (For the example above, transitioning the issue to 'not done' and then once more to 'in progress' works.)
fields.summary: Running a JQL Query Involving Change History Using a TemporaryIndexProvider Misses Search Results

fields.description: Atlassian support requires a timezone identifier to be included to date timestamps to all log4j log files configured.
fields.summary: Add Timezone identifier for Jira logs

fields.description:
During the import of XML backup, it fails to restore saying it is not able able to create 'x' total users without displaying their usernames.

This causes confusion and makes it impossible to fix the backup.xml since no names are shown.
fields.summary: During restoration of XML backup display users that can't be created.

fields.description:
If the remote directory in which a user resides is disabled, then the user's username appears on issues and comments instead of the user's display name. This may create significant confusion when trying to search for issues and comments.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a remote directory connector with active users.
 # Create an issue and assign it to a user who resides in the remote directory. Example, {{"Jim Botsfarm"}}. Note that the user's Full Name (display name) is shown in the Assignee field.
 # Delete the user from the remote directory.
 # Disable the remote directory (*⚙* > *User management* > *User directories*) in which this user resides.

h3. Expected Results

The user's full name (display name) appears in the Assignee field appended with {{[X]}}. Example, {{"Jim Botsfarm [X]"}}.
h3. Actual Results

The user's lowercase username appears in the Assignee field instead. Example, {{"jbotsfarm"}}.
h3. Notes

This is unexpected because the data in the {{cwd_user}} table is not changed. We see {{deleted_externally}} set to 1, and the {{"[X]"}} we expect is present in the {{display_name}} column.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When a remote user directory is disabled, user display names are changed to lower_user_name on issues and comments

fields.description:
It would be great if users could choose a title instead of an URL in the URL Custom Field.

Right now, you need to add https://google.com for example if you want an URL. It would be nice if you were able to add this URL and a clickable title like `Google`.
fields.summary: Allow Titles in URL Custom Field

fields.description:

{noformat}

h3. Notes
* Deprication notice: 
bq. The XML-RPC and SOAP APIs are deprecated since Confluence 5.5, and may not work as expected.
from [confluence xml-rpc and-soap apis|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/confluence-xml-rpc-and-soap-apis/]
* Removal 
bq.  Confluence’s SOAP, JSON-RPC and XML-RPC APIs were deprecated ... While they continue to work today, Confluence Cloud will be officially removing these APIs as of March 29th, 2019.
from [confluence-cloud soap-api migration|https://blog.developer.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud-soap-api-migration/]

It looks like the search function uses RPC which is deprecated/not supported on Confluence Cloud. Maybe time to switch to using REST for search instead?

h3. Workaround

Paste the link to the Confluence Cloud page directly instead of using the search function. No workaround if you wish to use search.
fields.summary: Search does not work for Confluence Cloud Application Link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When switching the language to Dutch in the user profile, The issue types' workflow/fields don't load from _Project settings > Issue types_, although they load properly when the language is set to English.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Project (e.g Scrum Project)
 # Go to _Profile > Preferences_ and set the Language to *Dutch (the Netherlands)*
 # Go to _Project Settings > Issue type_ and click on one of the issue types (e.g Sub-task)
 # Click on the *Workflow* or *Fields* button

h3. Expected Results

You should see the screen for the Workflow/Fields associated with the issue type in question.

!Screen Shot 2019-10-04 at 12.56.43 PM.png|width=212,height=112!     !Screen Shot 2019-10-04 at 12.56.30 PM.png|width=213,height=113!
h3. Actual Results

The screen for the Workflow/Fields keeps spinning and doesn't load.

   !image-2019-10-04-13-13-37-476.png|width=212,height=112!

 

Here are the error logs from the console:

[^10.125.91.228-1570188956131.log]
h3. Workaround

Switching back the language to English will make it work.
fields.summary: Issue type's workflow/fields not loading when the language is switched to Dutch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Feature requested in Devhelp: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-3492
{quote}
Hi Team

In Jira UPM "Manage apps" link in both Cog menu and in system menu bar leads to find apps link <JIRA_URL>/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace?source=side_nav_find_new_addons instead of <JIRA_URL>/plugins/servlet/upm?source=side_nav_manage_addons

It is correct in Bamboo, partially in Bitbucket, Confluence and even in Fisheye and Crucible.

Why not in Jira?

I would like to Manage my Apps not find new ones from cog menu.
{quote}

h3. Environment
Any browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the "Manage apps" link in Cog menu

or

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The audit_log table has a category with a tailing blank space for the "boards " category:

!image-2019-10-03-15-25-35-260.png|width=520,height=73!

This appends a "#" character after the column name, which shows that there's a blank space in the category name:
{code:sql}
select distinct category ||'#' as category from audit_log where category != trim(category) order by 1
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira
 # Query the audit_log table, specifically searching for "boards" and notice that it has a trailing blank space

h3. Expected Results

There should not be a trailing blank space. The category should be "boards" rather than "boards ".

h3. Workaround
N/A

{panel:title=My title}

{panel}

No overlapping panels

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira randomly does not return username result using the following REST API call when there's a large number of users in Jira (in both Internal & External Directory)

* <Jira URL>/rest/api/latest/user/search?includeInactive=true&maxResults=1000&username=<insert username>


h3. Environment

Jira 8.3, 8.4


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create more than 10,000 users using Jira Data Generator.
# Search for a username using this REST API call: <Jira URL>/rest/api/latest/user/search?includeInactive=true&maxResults=1000&username=<insert username>


h3. Expected Results

* Jira shows each user's detail


h3. Actual Results

* Browser shows "[]" respond indicating that Jira did not find the user.


h3. Notes

(i) Bug does not affect each user. Jira does return some random users.


h3. Workaround

Searching using the following REST API call seems to be showing each user:

*  <Jira URL>/rest/api/2/user?username=<insert username>
fields.summary: Jira randomly does not return username result using REST API call
As a user I want the JQL to be updated with custom fields names instead of their IDs after clicking on a column header to sort by that field

h3. Summary
When logging in with a destination URL that contains a hash, the logged in user will be redirected to a non-existent page or page without parameters. The URL will be the one before the hash.

 # Log out of Jira.
 # Head to a URL that contains a hash. For example, of a comment anchor. It could be something like this.

{code:java}
 <jira-url>/browse/KEY-123?focusedCommentId=10000&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-10000.{code}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

When users try to create an issue using new browser window (tab), the value specified in Linked Issues field is reset (is removed) if validator on creation fails; rest of the values like sprint, labels, component etc retained.

The issue is reproducible in 7.13.2, 7.13.3, and 8.4.1
h3. Environment:

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Can be reproduced in any of the following versions: 7.13.2, 7.13.3 and 8.4.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Click "Create" button, and open create screen NOT as pop-up option, but in new browser window.
 # Put issue into Linked Issues field.
 # Leave any of the mandatory fields empty (example: leave field "Summary" empty).
 # Click create.

h3. Expected Results:
 # ++ System doesn't allow to create request.
 # ++ System throws an error "You must specify summary of the issue".
 # ++ System leaves user's input within Linked Issue field in place.

h3. Actual Results:
 # ++ System doesn't allow to create request.
 # ++ System throws an error "You must specify summary of the issue".
 # – System purges the value, provided by user inside "Linked issues" field.

{noformat}
...
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround:

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When using new browser tab to create an issue (as compared to pop-up) - Value inside Linked Issues field disappears if validator on creation fails

fields.description:
WikiRenderer does not recognize many useful URL schemes.
“[name|url]” notation works correctly for ‘http’, ‘https’, ‘ftp’, ‘file’, and ‘mailto’ schemes in URL.
 It does not work for other standard URL schemes like ‘data’ and ‘tel’.
It also does not work for custom schemes like 'doors’.
Surprisingly,  'Default Text Rendrer' recognizes 'doors' URLs e.g.
doors://dewup-ap71:36677/?version=2&prodID=0&view=0000001b&urn=urn:telelogic::1-4c57d7d104e43e04-O-8-000083a9


We suppose that enhancing functionality of renderers in Atlassian software if quite an easy task: extend regular expressions to detect multiple URL schemes and then, when user clicks the link,  just forward ‘open url’ request to the web browser.
fields.summary: Enhance processing  of hyperlinks in WikiRenderer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Wiki markup is inconsistent in how it treats empty cells in a table.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try creating a table where the empty cell is there, but there is no space within this empty cell.
 For Example:
{code:java}
|1|ABC|Yes|Yes|Yes|
|2||No|No|Yes|
|3|XYZ|Yes|||
|4||No|Yes|No|
{code}
# When it tries to render, wiki markup considers this empty cell as no cell. Hence the result is like this:
|1|ABC|Yes|Yes|Yes|
|2||No|No|Yes|
|3|XYZ|Yes|
|4||No|Yes|No|
# Now create a table where empty cells are there, and there's space in the empty cells. For example:
{code:java}
| 1 | ABC | Yes | Yes | Yes | 
| 2 | | No | No | Yes | 
| 3 | XYZ | Yes | | | 
| 4 | | No | Yes | No | 
{code}
# In this case, wiki markup translates it as a cell with no content/empty cell. Hence it gets rendered like this:
|1|ABC|Yes|Yes|Yes|
|2| |No|No|Yes|
|3|XYZ|Yes| | |
|4| |No|Yes|No|

h3. Expected Results
The table should be rendered correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The table is not rendered correctly.

h3. Notes
In the first example, it does not require space to consider a cell as a cell. See |Sunday|, it gets rendered as a cell even though there is no space there. Now, when there is || which doesn't have space either, but it doesn't take it as a cell. Both of them have no space.
Able to replicate this behavior on 7.13.0, 8.2.2

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to have space in the empty cells so that the table is rendered correctly.
fields.summary: Wiki markup is inconsistent in how it treats empty cells in a table.

Currently the [Monitor a user's activity|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/monitor-a-user-s-activity-938847027.html] document doesn't provide details on what "requests" here mean and in what scenarios would you see:

fields.description:
h4. Issue

* Currently, when Jira connects to the Oracle database in the installation wizard, it only has the option of configuring hostname, port, service, username, and password. 
* Because Jira doesn't have a way to point to a tnsnames.ora file or manually construct the connection string to utilize either Oracle Wallet OR the Java Keystore (JKS) methods, we are not able to use Oracle Autonomous Transaction Processing, which is very crucial to our business. 

h4. Sample from tnsnames.ora
{noformat}
oacipoc_tp = (description= (address=(protocol=tcps)(port=1522)(host=adb.us-ashburn-1.oraclecloud.com))(connect_data=(service_name=wijnknlzqi7jmor_oacipoc_tp.atp.oraclecloud.com))(security=(ssl_server_cert_dn=
"CN=adwc.uscom-east-1.oraclecloud.com,OU=Oracle BMCS US,O=Oracle Corporation,L=Redwood City,ST=California,C=US")) )
{noformat}

h4. sample from ojdbc.properties:
{noformat}
oracle.net.wallet_location=(SOURCE=(METHOD=FILE)(METHOD_DATA=(DIRECTORY=/u01/app/oracle/wallet)))
{noformat}

h4. Suggestions

* Ideally, during the installation wizard, after you selected "oracle" as your DB type, there would be an "advanced" button, where when you clicked it, it would allow a user to input a fully formed JDBC connect string. (Or even better, an "Oracle Cloud" option which would just allow the user to select the downloaded wallet.zip file, read the file, and select the proper connect stanza)

* In addition,  when the user clicked "next" on the bottom of the DB setup screen that the installer would test for a file named something like 'oracledbsetup.xml'. If the file existed, that the connect string in the file would over-ride whatever data was inputted in the DB setup dialogue and allow us to provide the connection string that way so that we would be able to use Oracle Autonomous Transaction Processing.
fields.summary: Allow advanced options when connecting to Oracle database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Server*. Using *Jira Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73086].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently when trying to search JQL and using the [project field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-ProjectProject], the only supported operators are
{quote}= , !=, IS , IS NOT, IN , NOT IN
{quote}
It does not currently support the use of the WAS or WAS NOT operators.
h3. Why this would be helpful

Extending tracking to an issue's project history here would be very useful in order to try to search for issues that were not initially created in the current project, but rather were moved from another project. Right now, JQL does not have a native way to search for issues that have been moved from another project.
h3. Workaround

It seems to be something that 3rd party plugins have tried to solve, such as described in [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/View-issues-that-have-been-moved-from-one-project-to-another/qaq-p/790346]
 However to have Jira be able to do this natively would be preferred.
fields.summary: Add support for the WAS operator to project field when JQL searching

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Trying to clear the Default resolution results in an XSRF security token missing page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Jira Administration > Issues > Resolutions
# Click the _Clear default resolutions_ link:  
# !image-2019-10-01-18-03-20-460.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The default resolution is cleared.

h3. Actual Results
An XSRF missing token screen is shown: 
!image-2019-10-01-18-02-51-519.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Credit to [~e6a44563da75]
bq. A possible workaround is to create a new throw-away resolution. Make the new resolution the default and then delete the new resolution
* Delete the default resolution from database: {code}DELETE FROM
	jiraschema.propertyentry 
WHERE
	ENTITY_NAME='jira.properties' AND 
	PROPERTY_KEY='jira.constant.default.resolution'{code}
fields.summary: Trying to clear the Default resolution results in an XSRF security token missing page

fields.description:
Usecase: I know there is a filter called 2019-6.1Consider Epics tried to use {color:#FF0000}2019-6.1Consider Epics{color} as a search term in Find Filters in Issue Navigator, and would expect the filter called exactly that to be at the top of the list of results, based on relevance. However, it gives me 737 results, some which have 2019 in the title (even where not suffixed "-6.1" some which have "Consider" in the title and some which have "Epics" in the title. 

In this instance, I have found that searching {color:#FF0000}"2019-6.1Consider Epics" {color:#172b4d}with the inverted commas has returned only the desired result (so good learning for me, suggest might be worth putting that in as a tip into the "Filters are issue searches that have been saved for re-use. This page allows you to search all filters that you can see." text but that's a side issue) however I still think that sort by relevance would help me and many other users, as I remember other occasions where two keywords didn't do this but also they weren't necessarily in the correct order for the " workaround to be successful. {color}{color}
fields.summary: Give "Find Filters" function search results sort by relevance option please

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira currently has no way of exporting the Custom Fields, their values, and their context. 

Using the UI, the admin will have to search through multiple pages of results and no way to copy the values to quickly view the data. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a way to export all the Custom Fields, Custom Field Values, and the context.

This will allow admins to quickly browse a list of the Custom Fields to know their context among other information. 
h3. Workaround

Using the UI, you can filter through the search box for issues that have a global context. 

The following PSQL will retrieve the customfield names that are Global. 
{code:java}
Select cfname 
FROM customfield cf 
INNER JOIN configurationcontext cc 
  ON 'customfield_'||cf.id = cc.customfield 
  Where cc.project is null
{code}
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to Export Custom Field values so that I can administer custom fields more effectively.

fields.description:
As a Jira user who needs to create a lot of filters and grant Editor permissions to the same set of users, I'd like to count with a user preference for my new filters to be automatically editable by my selected option (Group, Project or User), so that I don't have to manually add the same editors over and over again.

There's a similar preference for auto-sharing filters (well, just with _public_ or _private_ as selectable options).
fields.summary: Preference for auto-adding Editors in new filters

fields.description: Currently, it is possible to link a Confluence page to a Jira issue through the usage of application links. This link will tell users that there is a page linked to the issue, and to access the page's contents you have to click on the link and access Confluence. However, as a Jira admin, I would like to be able to directly display the contents of a Confluence page in the *View Issue* page.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I would like to be able to display a Confluence page's contents in a Jira issue.

fields.description:
In the "Installing Jira Data Center" docs, under Cluster.properties file parameters, it lists
|{{ehcache.listener.socketTimeoutMillis}}|No|By default, this is set to the EhCache default.|

In the EHCache docs, it lists this default as 2000ms. [https://www.ehcache.org/documentation/2.8/replication/rmi-replicated-caching.html#configuring-the-cachemanagerpeerlistener]

 

However looking at the source code, it is clear this is being set by Jira to 5000ms. [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRASERVER/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/cluster/DefaultEhCacheConfigurationFactory.java?at=refs%2Ftags%2F7.13.7#48]

 

Please update the docs to reflect this.
fields.summary: Update "Installing Jira Data Center" docs to reflect default ehcache.listener.socketTimeoutMillis

fields.description: Currently we have to manually add every single GitHub repository into our Jira DVCS configuration as we need them. Ideally we'd like to be able to add repositories automatically via webhook when they are created in GitHub, or at the very least it would be nice if there was an option to automatically add all repos from the account. New repos are in the DVCS account's dropdown, so Jira knows they exist.
fields.summary: Allow webhook access to Jira DVCS admin

fields.description:
*Background*

We now have an officially supported Docker image for Jira Software server (+ others) - good work Atlassian!

*Request*

When we deploy inside an AWS ECS environment (i.e. AWS' managed Docker service), we like to inject secrets (DB credentials, etc) via a service called AWS Secrets Manager.  This simply injects the decrypted secret value via an environment variable. Unfortunately it's a single, JSON-formatted string with multiple values

*Suggestion*

Add a variable called *ATL_AWS_SECRETSMANAGER_DB_CREDS*, and parse the individual values (host, port, user, pass, etc) from this, instead of passing individual values via individual env vars.
fields.summary: Add support for AWS SecretsManager to Docker images

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the {{lower_user_name}} is changed to only numeric value, JQL query with WAS operator doesn't return expected results


h3. Environment
7.13.6


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # *Create* a user with numeric only username or *Rename* a user from text to numeric viz., {{abrajtxhd}} to {{45671234}}
 # Assign some issue(s) to {{45671234}}
 # Run {{assignee was 43387518}} 

{code:sql}select * from app_user where lower_user_name like '%45671234%' or user_key like '%45671234%';{code}

||id||user_key||lower_user_name||
|10382|abrajtxhd|45671234|

h3. Expected Results

JQL filter returns current and old issues with assignee 43387518

h3. Actual Results

JQL filter returns no result:
!correct_results.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to use *double-quote* or *single quote* around the numeric username to get the expected results: 

{{assignee was '45671234'}}
!no_result.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JQL filter with only numeric "assignee" field doesn't work with WAS operator

fields.description:
Improve on the logging and messaging for CSV imports.

Currently the importer will not report on issues updated in the UI and would say 0 issues imported successfully, even though issues were updated by the CSV importer.
This causes confusion and makes you think no issues were updated.
 !import.png|thumbnail! 

Also when the importers log is downloaded and viewed it has a misleading message.
{code}
INFO - ------------------------------
INFO - Importing: Issues
INFO - ------------------------------
INFO - Only new items will be imported
...
INFO - Reindexing took 300 ms.
INFO - 5 issues successfully created
INFO - ------------------------------
INFO - Finished Importing : Issues
INFO - ------------------------------
{code}
Where these 5 issues was actually updated and not "created"

Can the logging and messaging show a more accurate representation of the tasks done by the CSV importer.
fields.summary: Improve on CSV import logging

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since Jira 8.3.2, to address rendering issues in the issue navigator when users added more field columns than fit on the screen, users now need to navigate to the bottom of the screen to see a horizontal scroll bar and navigate to the remaining columns.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access to JIRA JQL filter search
 # Add more columns into the search results
 # Perform a JQL search query

h3. Expected Results

!expecte.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

!example.png|thumbnail!

Users will also be unable to drag and drop columns to the right most side if horizontal scroll bar is present.
h3. Workaround

Horizontal scrolling is available by using:
 * Touchpad
 * Shift + mouse scroll
 * Keyboard arrows
fields.summary: Horizontal scroll bar is only displayed at the bottom of the screen on issue navigator

fields.description:
It would be good to have a clearly defined list of steps taken by the XML import, to make it easier for users to understand what will happen and what is required. For example, the XML backup may only have one of the 2 files required due to unzipping and zipping files and since Jira does not validate if one of files is missing, it will give errors that do not make it clear what is happening.

The suggestion is to either update the function for the XML import to validate that a zip file is being loaded and that both the entities.xml and activeobjects.xml are present.
fields.summary: Indicate how does the XML import works

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Option to add category in custom field "Select list (Single Choice)" instead of using "Select list (cascading)"

Example:
 * Heading1
value0
value1
 * Heading2
value0
value1

 
h3. Suggested Solution

Use 3rd party add-on like [Tree customfield|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219011/tree-customfield?hosting=server&tab=overview]

Sometimes, when we started creating a ticket, there may be other "disturbances :)" before clicking create button, and sometimes ticket is lost since we unknowingly close the browser /tab...
 
So, we are looking for a "Save" ticket feature before Create it.
In the half-way through, we can save and open the ticket again, then edit and submit. 
 
Thanks.

fields.description:
As a Jira project administrator, I want to edit all workflows, screens, fields, schemas, etc even when these entities are shared across projects in case I have admin permission in ALL that projects

Scenario 1.

Given I'm a project admin in project Pa & Pb

And workflow Wa is shared between tickets in projects Pa and Pb

When I click on edit workflow Wa

Then I see admin controls to edit workflow


Scenario 2.

Given I'm a project admin in project Pa and don't have admin permissions in project Pb

And workflow Wa is shared between tickets in projects Pa and Pb

When I click on edit workflow Wa

Then I see a note that Jira admin helps is required to modify workflow

h3. Problem Definition
There must be an ability to restrict the number of issues assigned to an assignee.

The customer would like to restrict number issues (count max to 6 or 7) assigned to an user at a time and put rest in the queue in a project.
h3. Suggested Solution
NA
fields.summary: Limit number of issues assigned to an assignee

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On 7.4, we started allowing Project Administrators to make changes to workflows and screens of the project, taking certain restrictions in considerations. However, there are other settings that can be project-specific that we only allow Jira Administrators to perform the changes.

h3. Suggested Solution

In a similar method, we can also enable project-level admins to make changes to the permission scheme used by the project, taking into consideration the same restrictions that we have on other functionalities.

h3. Why this is important

This helps by eliminating a possible bottleneck on project configurations - usually, there are multiple admins in a project, while we have just a few global admins for a multitude of projects.
fields.summary: Allow Project Admins to make changes to the Permission Scheme used by the project
Not selecting any sub-task while performing Bulk operation loses the current search

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users from some organizations  are not able to run the app in the MDM (mobile device management) context. This is necessary to be able to access internal services such as Jira, which is only accessible within the company network. Because of security reasons, Jira won't be made accessible outside of their company network and must therefore run the app in the MDM context for example using Citrix Secure Hub.

Citrix Secure Hub is the launchpad for the mobile productivity apps. Users enroll their devices in Secure Hub to gain access to the app store. From the app store, they can add Citrix-developed mobile productivity apps and third-party apps (source: https://docs.citrix.com/en-us/citrix-secure-hub).

h3. Suggested Solution

Create and share the ipa file so that it can be added to the Citrix Secure Hub.
 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Share ipa file for Jira server mobile App

fields.description:
It is cruicial for for Jira Service Desk projects or Core/Software projects with a JSD-like model to send notifications immediatelly vs batching. The good example is when customer replies to JSD ticket and support engineer receives the update with several minutes delay (plus email routing/delivery time overhead). This may be not acceptable for high priority tickets and at the moment forced us to disable notifications batching.

We would like to see the ability to enable this feature per project or at least for the beginning per project type. Not sure if this is easier or more userful than per-user (JRASERVER-69332), but it certainly can improve JSD communications with customers.
fields.summary: Option to manage email batching per project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * In order to track who enabled/disabled time tracking, admins have to inspect the access logs.
 * It's not possible to track when and by who config changes were done to time tracking.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add any time tracking admin changes to the audit logs.
h3. Workaround

When time tracking is enabled, an HTTP POST is sent to *<CONTEXT_PATH>/secure/admin/TimeTrackingActivate.jspa*. 
 Therefore, admins can find out when and by who time tracking was enabled by searching for the request in the access logs under *<JIRA_INSTALL>/logs*: 
 (i) Be sure to replace */<CONTEXT_PATH>* below or remove it if you're not using a context path.
 * For time tracking activation:
{code:java|bgColor=#f8f8f8}
grep "POST /<CONTEXT_PATH>/secure/admin/TimeTrackingActivate.jspa" access_log.*
{code}

 * For time tracking de-activation:
{code:java|bgColor=#f8f8f8}
grep "POST /<CONTEXT_PATH>/secure/admin/TimeTrackingDeActivate.jspa" access_log.*
{code}
fields.summary: Audit log time tracking admin events (enable/disable/configuration change)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When web links are added to the Application Navigator in Jira (or any other Atlassian product) and Application Links to another product are created, those links will be shared across the two products. This may create duplicates in the Application Navigator if the links only differ in trailing slash. 
h3. Suggested Solution
While comparing links to display in the menu, the Application Navigator should ignore the trailing slash. 
h3. Workaround
* Delete the links and re-create them without a trailing slash. 
* Make it a practice to never include the trailing slash when creating the Application Links or adding links to the Application Navigator.
fields.summary: The Application Navigator should ignore the trailing slash while comparing URLs

fields.description:
We have custom fields from a 3rd party plugin (Elements Connect) that are required for all issue types.

As the Jira Server mobile app currently doesn't support custom fields from plugins, we cannot create any issues using the app.

When viewing the issues, the field is not visible, but it contains critical information for us and needs to be there for the app to be useful in our setup.

Custom fields and custom fields from plugins are a critical factor in making sure the mobile app experience lines up with the desktop one.
fields.summary: Support for custom plugin fields for issue creation and view

fields.description:
When configuring a mail handler it is pretty straightforward that when receiving Bulk mail a decision will be indicated to let the handler know what to do with Bulk email.

This is not a problem by itself but in the documentation, it is not really explained that the Bulk mail "filter" will apply over every other validation in the handler, and it is possible that users might expect that other validations will be done first, like the "Catch email address".

 

The suggestion is to specify that the Bulk email validation is done before any other validation.
fields.summary: Clarify documentation regarding Bulk mail

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of September 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#B2D4FF | titleBGColor=#B2D4FF | bgColor=#EAF1FC}
Microsoft has not released any major updates for IE11 since 2015, and has [recently discouraged the use of IE11 as a default browser|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/The-perils-of-using-Internet-Explorer-as-your-default-browser/ba-p/331732]. 

To allow us to continue to take advantage of modern web standards to deliver improved functionality and the best possible user experience across all of our products, we have decided to end support for IE11. *Jira 8.5 Enterprise Release will be the last IE11-supported version.*

End of support means we will not fix bugs that are specific to IE11, and will begin to introduce features that aren't compatible with this browser. 

Find out more about this change from our [announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312].

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.

{panel}
fields.summary: Plans to end support for IE11

Any Jira instance
h3. Steps to Reproduce

2. Perform back up

On your environment nodes should have different IP addresses or different cache listener ports._(!) Add to the *clusternode* table new node with same IP address and cache listener port as the current running node. For instance:
 !image-2019-09-24-13-21-51-077.png|thumbnail! 
4. Import backup

h3. Expected Results
 !image-2019-09-24-13-15-55-342.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results

The NullPointerException is thrown in the log file

fields.description:
As of Jira 8.4, it is possible to abuse the password recovery system by requesting the recovery, going backwards in the web browser, and requesting it again, repeating the process as much as wanted. This can be exploited to create a possible overload of Jira Mail queue as well as the email service.

The suggestion is to implement a feature to detect when the same password recovery like a CAPTCHA to prevent automated spam of this case.
fields.summary: Prevent Password recovery spam

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, going one single user over the license limit of the Jira license installed in the server will place the instance in "read-only mode", with the following warning being displayed:

{{You will not be able to create new issues because the user limit for your JIRA instance has been exceeded, please contact your JIRA administrators.}}

This essentially causes an outage until admins are able to adjust the licensed users to go under the limit.

h3. Suggested Solution:
Instead of blocking all users from creating tickets, we could either:
* Block only the users who recently were granted a license that went over the limit.
* Deny users from being granted a license if that will place the instance over the license limit.

h3. Why this is needed:
The current behavior essentially causes an outage on Jira instances that face this behavior, which can be very troublesome.
fields.summary: Jira should not go into read-only mode when the license limit is exceeded

fields.description: We are currently using tempo for time tracking and although tempo does not allow users to delete worklogs from a locked time period, you are still able to do so from the "Work Log" tab of the issue detail page. Tempo informed us this is out of their control and suggested to hide the "Work Log" tab from the issue detail page. However, we still need the "Work Log" tab of the issue detail page for reporting purposes and are requesting JIRA to add a feature to not allow deleting work logs from locked period or the ability to lock periods similar to tempo to avoid this issue from happening in the future.
fields.summary: Ability to lock work logs so no changes can be made

fields.description:
I have searched this for a long time and did not find a straight answer or information in the documentation that provide instructions on how to custom a date field in a way that it will appear in YYYY/MM/DD HH:MM where HH is in 24 hour format, without affecting all date fields already existing in my Jira instance or project.

For our business case, we need a field that will show a time the task is due. Yes, completing a task at 10 am or at 3 pm can make it or break it for us.

If this is already implemented in Jira Server, please let me know where to find this information.

If this is not already implemented, I would like to request this. 

Thanks,

Roberta
fields.summary: Ability to configure custom field to view date and time without applying change globally

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Table {{projectroleactor}} is used for storing project level permissions, example:
{noformat}
select * from projectroleactor;
  id   |  pid  | projectroleid |          roletype          |  roletypeparameter
-------+-------+---------------+----------------------------+---------------------
 10000 |       |         10000 | atlassian-group-role-actor | jira-users
 10001 |       |         10001 | atlassian-group-role-actor | jira-developers
 10002 |       |         10002 | atlassian-group-role-actor | jira-administrators
 10106 | 10001 |         10000 | atlassian-group-role-actor | jira-users
 10107 | 10001 |         10002 | atlassian-group-role-actor | jira-administrators
 11300 | 10800 |         10002 | atlassian-group-role-actor | jira-administrators
 11301 | 10800 |         10001 | atlassian-group-role-actor | jira-developers
 11303 | 10800 |         10000 | atlassian-group-role-actor | jira-administrators
 11703 | 11000 |         10002 | atlassian-user-role-actor  | admin
 ...
{noformat}

Table config:
{noformat}
\d projectroleactor;
            Table "public.projectroleactor"
      Column       |          Type          | Modifiers
-------------------+------------------------+-----------
 id                | numeric(18,0)          | not null
 pid               | numeric(18,0)          |
 projectroleid     | numeric(18,0)          |
 roletype          | character varying(255) |
 roletypeparameter | character varying(255) |
Indexes:
    "pk_projectroleactor" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "role_pid_idx" btree (pid)
    "role_player_idx" btree (projectroleid, pid)
{noformat}

* Columns {{ROLETYPE}} and {{ROLETYPEPARAMETER}} is being used during data loading in *getProjectIdsContainingRoleActorByKeyAndType*
* which is used in API *getProjectIdsContainingRoleActorByNameAndType* 
* and it's being used in *ViewUserProjectRoles* page (URL: secure/admin/user/ViewUserProjectRoles!default.jspa)

Produced SQL:
{noformat}
2019-09-23 19:37:19,973 http-nio-8080-exec-5 admin 1176x480x1 vphgel /secure/admin/user/ViewUserProjectRoles!default.jspa 2ms "SELECT DISTINCT PID FROM public.projectroleactor WHERE ROLETYPE='atlassian-user-role-actor' AND ROLETYPEPARAMETER='admin'"
{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an extra cover index (ROLETYPEPARAMETER, ROLETYPE, ID) (in that order since _ROLETYPE_ has only 2 values) to the table to reduce DB load and improve loading time. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Add index manually.
* Example for MSSQL
{code:sql|borderStyle=solid}
CREATE NONCLUSTERED INDEX [idx_role_type_param_pid] ON [dbo].[projectroleactor] ([ROLETYPEPARAMETER], [ROLETYPE], [PID])
{code}
fields.summary: Add role_type_param_pid index to the projectroleactor table

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Table {{columnlayoutitem}} is used for storing Fields schema configs, example:
{noformat}
select * from columnlayoutitem;
  id   | columnlayout |  fieldidentifier   | horizontalposition
-------+--------------+--------------------+--------------------
 10300 |        10000 | issuetype          |                  0
 10301 |        10000 | issuekey           |                  1
 10302 |        10000 | summary            |                  2
 10303 |        10000 | assignee           |                  3
 10304 |        10000 | reporter           |                  4
 ...
{noformat}

Table config:
{noformat}
\d columnlayoutitem
             Table "public.columnlayoutitem"
       Column       |          Type          | Modifiers
--------------------+------------------------+-----------
 id                 | numeric(18,0)          | not null
 columnlayout       | numeric(18,0)          |
 fieldidentifier    | character varying(255) |
 horizontalposition | numeric(18,0)          |
Indexes:
    "pk_columnlayoutitem" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "idx_cli_fieldidentifier" btree (fieldidentifier)
{noformat}

So the table doesn't have index for the *columnlayout* column. 
{{columnlayout}} is being used during data loading:
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.column.DefaultColumnLayoutManager#transformToColumnLayoutItems
...
 final List<GenericValue> columnLayoutItemGVs = ofBizDelegator.getRelated("ChildColumnLayoutItem", columnLayoutGV, ImmutableList.of("horizontalposition ASC"));
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an extra index to the table to reduce DB load and improve loading time.

h3. Workaround 
Add index manually.
* Example for MSSQL
{code:sql|borderStyle=solid}
CREATE NONCLUSTERED INDEX [idx_cli_columnlayout] ON [dbo].[columnlayoutitem] ([COLUMNLAYOUT])
{code}
fields.summary: Add COLUMNLAYOUT index to the columnlayoutitem table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Issue Collectors* page that is contained inside the *Project Settings* section of a project will not load correctly if the user has its language set to french.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go into your profile and change the display language to french.
# Load the *Issue collectors* page inside the *Project settings*.

h3. Expected Results
Page loads as expected, showing all the existing issue collectors.

h3. Actual Results
The page will load with some formatting errors, not all issue collectors will be displayed and the following exception will be thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} log file:
{code}
2019-09-23 11:21:43,797 http-nio-8080-exec-15 ERROR padmin 681x388x1 18bk2nn 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/ViewCollectors!default.jspa [c.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager] MethodInvocationException occurred getting message body from Velocity: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unmatched braces in the pattern.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unmatched braces in the pattern.
{code}
h3. Workaround
Change the profile language to any other available language and load the page.
fields.summary: Issue collector page inside Project Admin is broken when user's language is set to french

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
View voters results in N+2 requests. (N = number of votes on the issue)

h3. Environment
 * Jira issue with many votes (N)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open 'View issue' page
 # Click on number of voters
 # Check network tab in browser

h3. Expected Results
* Dialogue with voters opens
* 1 REST call is performed

h3. Actual Results
* Dialogue opens
* N+2 requests to {{rest/api/2/issue/<ISSUE-KEY>/votes}} are performed
* Browser tab freezes

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: View voters results in N requests

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Microsoft has released SQL 2019 [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/sql-server/sql-server-201|https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/sql-server/sql-server-2019]
h3. Suggested Solution

To officially support Microsoft SQL Server 2019 as one of the Jira supported databases.
h3. Why this is important

Jira should be supported against Generally Available releases of Databases that have been supported on previous versions.
fields.summary: Add support for Jira on Microsoft SQL Server 2019

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Setting properties and options on startup requires accessing the application server directly per [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html]. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 As a customer, I would like the option to set properties and options on startup from Jira's web interface.
fields.summary: Allow setting properties and options on startup from the web interface
New global permission "create projects"

fields.description:
Linking issues in Jira Cloud from the "Edit issue" interface seems to be much harder than it needs to be.

The auto-updating "history search" only retrieves recently viewed issues. It is opaque how this is cached (browser or Atlassian server?) and how many issues it caches.

Clicking "+" only allows you to select recent issues or issues from a pre-made filter. This "Issue Selector" interface is more or less useless because it is unreasonable to expect the user to have set up filters for every issue in the project (filters where the issue must be in the first 50 found)

This means that you either need to have visited the issue you wish to link to recently or to memorise the issue key to find it. Most users (understandably) do not think in terms of AB-456, they think "I want to link to that issue called "Test the Blue Widget"."

Bizarrely, when you link to something via the (old) issue view a different interface appears which allows you to perform a normal text search by keyword.

The New Issue View is very much better for linking issues so thank you for considering this in the redesign, but has so many oft-reported drawbacks it is not an option for most of your users in it's current "beta" state.
fields.summary: Consistent and usable experience for linking issues on Jira Cloud from "Edit Issue"

fields.description:
As of Jira Service Desk 4.4, when configuring custom notifications it is possible to use the variable ${request.details} to show fields from the issue. The problem here is that all empty fields are also included. This by itself would not be a source of confusion if it wasn't by the fact that the issue view screens do not show these fields.

The request is to allow hiding empty fields when using the ${request.details} variable to keep a consistent look over the issue information across notifications and Jira.
fields.summary: Allow hiding empty fields when using the variable ${request.details}
jira.permission.createclone.denied workflow property breakes new createmeta REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Smart Attachments vendor was refactoring their app, they encountered an issue with workflow validators. They renamed class names for their validators and conditions and looks like Jira uses class names instead of the keys as when they did the update the validators failed to operate:

{code}
<workflow-validator key="category-is-not-empty-validator" i18n-name-key="attach.cat.workflow.validator.category-is-not-empty"
class="com.stiltsoft.jira.attachcategory.workflow.validators.CategoryNotEmptyImpl">
<description key="attach.cat.workflow.validator.category-not-empty.description"/>
<validator-class>com.stiltsoft.jira.attachcategory.workflow.validators.CategoryNotEmpty</validator-class>
<resource type="velocity" name="view" location="/vm/validators-conditions/category-not-empty-view.vm"/>
<resource type="velocity" name="input-parameters" location="/vm/validators-conditions/category-not-empty-edit.vm"/>
<resource type="velocity" name="edit-parameters" location="/vm/validators-conditions/category-not-empty-edit.vm"/>
</workflow-validator>
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Clone https://bitbucket.org/Vinceal/rename-workflow-item/src
# Start Jira 7.7.0
# Create "Process Management" project
# Install SmartAttachements 1.17.4
# Activate SmartAttachments in project and add categories
# Edit project workflow and add validator "Category Not Empty" on Create of an issue
# Upgrade to SmartAttachements 1.18.0
# Try to create an issue
 !4ba3988c-d4fb-4c71-a677-7a070661787e.png|thumbnail! 
Recording:  [^Jira validator class name.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Class name is not used, the key is used instead

h3. Actual Results
Class name is use, The key is ignored.

h3. Workaround

Use the old class name
fields.summary: Workflow validators results in error when renaming class names instead of keys

fields.description: There is a request and a requirement to have an option to order/sort the issue links based on severity instead of 'priority'.
fields.summary: Add severity as a Sorting option in jira.view.issue.links.sort.order

fields.description:
We need to be able to create negative worklogs so that big corrections can be done.
The use case for this feature would be that accounting needs to be able make big corrections for a past time period. However, without the option to log e.g. "-100h" this would only be possible to achieve by removing/adjusting a lot of worklogs from issues manually. Not only is this a lot of overhead, but it also distorts the worklogs of the employees which don't add up afterwards (or it would be necessary to log their billable work to a ticket for non-billable work so that it adds up again).For a big company this gets very tedious or even impossible to manage.
fields.summary: Allow negative time for worklogs

fields.description:
Currently as per the KB , [Keyboard shortcuts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile066/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-keyboard-shortcuts] can only work from Jira's View Issue and Issue Navigator screens only.

It would be helpful if the same shortcuts are available with Jira backlog view .
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts should work in backlog view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira issue's history tab, there is a short version of time "updated 5 days ago". When you hover over the time, it'll show a longer version of time "updated 6 days ago <time>". 
 !Time.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

The shorter version and the longer version should display the same time. 

h3. Actual Results

The longer version of time is always one more day than the shorter version of time. 

h3. Workaround

[Disable relative dates in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-relative-dates-in-jira-applications-414187622.html] to avoid any confusion.
fields.summary: Jira issue history tab inconsistent date and time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Not able to configure different default fields for various project in a custom field (Select List (single choice)).

Say there is a custom field called "Levels" with option 1,2,3,4. Say Project A needs to have a default option 1, Project B needs default option 2, Project C needs default option 3.
h3. Suggested Solution

Option to configure the default option for each project in one _Context_ in Custom field configuration without creating a new context for each Project and repeating the options.

h3. Workaround

Add a new context for each Project and configure the options and set the default value.

This workaround is tiresome when there are a lot of projects that have the custom field which needs a different default value. Say if 10 Projects are having the custom field and each of them should have different values, we might need to configure 10 contexts and repeatedly configure the same options to set a default value.
fields.summary: Set different default values across different projects for the custom field (Select List (single choice))

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When issue has multiple components, the default assignee is not set as Unassigned, when following the rule assignee will be set to the default assignee of the component that is first alphabetically, rule

h3. Environment
8.2.4 8.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#Create a new project 
# set Default Assignee - Unassigned
# Add components  
Mac Book, Lead - Mark, Assignee - Component Lead
Dell, Lead - Dave, Assignee - Project Default
# Create issue with components Dell and Mac Book
# Check Assignee it will be set as Mark

h3. Expected Results
The Assignee should be Unassigned as stated in [Managing components|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-components-938847187.html] 

_ If an issue has multiple components, and the default assignees of components clash, the assignee will be set to the default assignee of the component that is first alphabetically._
h3. Actual Results
Assignee set is as Mark

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When issue has multiple components, the default assignee is not set Unassigned, when following the rule assignee will be set to the default assignee of the component that is first alphabetically, rule

fields.description:
Under *Administation > User Managment > Users* there is a dropdown menu _"Users per page"_.

If the total number of users is very large (read: millions), selecting "All" can cause Jira to run out of memory since the frame with the user list is built into one single char object that grows to several gigabytes!

!users-per-page-all.png|thumbnail!

_*+Suggestion+:*_ A switch to take away the option "All" from the _"Users per page"_ dropdown menu – or remove that option from being available altogether.
fields.summary: Ability to remove the possibility to select ALL for "Users per page" on the User Management page (can cause OutOfMemory)

fields.description:
As of Jira 8.3, when configuring Jira we need to set the minimum and maximum memory using the -Xms and -Xmx parameters, and in the case of trying to use scalable parameters JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY_PERCENTAGE and JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY_PERCENTAGE, Jira will still ask for -Xms and -Xmx.

Since Jira supports Java 1,8 it technically does accept the JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY_PERCENTAGE and JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY_PERCENTAGE but since Jira *requires* the -Xms and -Xmx parameters, they override the percentage ones, defeating the purpose.

The request is to allow Jira to use the JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY_PERCENTAGE and JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY_PERCENTAGE parameters to allow scalable memory allocation.
fields.summary: Support scalable memory allocation (JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY_PERCENTAGE and JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY_PERCENTAGE)
